name: Zonoids, Linear Dependence, and Size-Biased Distributions on the Simplex
abstraction: This paper analyses the problem represented by the presence of speculative bubbles on asset prices in general equilibrium models. The main results concerning the existence of solutions in intertemporal general equilibrium models are summarized, then the specific problem of asset pricing is discussed. In particular, the theoretical results concerning the existence of speculative bubbles on asset prices are presented, together with the results that can be obtained through a new approach, based on Euler equations. In the last part a series of examples in which speculative bubbles on asset prices do appear are illustrated, and the corresponding conditions that allow to exclude the presence of such bubbles are derived. Finally, some considerations are developed in order to match the predictions of the theory with the empirical observations concerning the behavior of asset prices.
